Exaggerate: The expert suggests that the claim may be an exaggerated expression of fears about a new technology.
Lack enough support: The expert points out that the dating of the report is anachronistic and there is no evidence to support its existence.
Problematic assumption: The expert questions the authenticity of the claim and suggests it may be an urban legend.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert proposes that the claim could be a modern piece of satire intended to highlight the ridiculousness of a 20th-century issue.
Contradict fact: The expert highlights that the term "horseless carriage" did not come into use until the 1890s, contradicting the claim's dating.
Falters at times: The expert mentions that the claim may falter due to its questionable authenticity and lack of supporting evidence.
